intro: Hymenopappus hintoniorum, commonly known as the Hinton's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It is characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. The plant is adapted to harsh, dry environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, and the plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas. Hymenopappus hintoniorum is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
